IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: C. C. Young is a multi-service retirement community dedicated to the elderly, their families and the community, providing programs and facilities in a continuum of care extending from home and community-based services to residential and full-time nursing care. Reflecting the Christian traditions of love, benevolence, and service, we strive to enhance the physical, mental, social, and spiritual well-being of the elderly.
IRS990.MissionDescription: C.C. YOUNG'S MISSION IS TO WORK WITH OTHERS TO TRANSFORM OUR COMPLEMENTARY SERVICE RESPONSES TO THE AGED. THROUGH COLLABORATION WE WILL INTENSIFY AND BROADEN OUR PROGRAMS AND SERVICES SO THAT EACH INDIVIDUAL MAY FLOURISH IN BODY, MIND, AND SPIRIT.
IRS990.Description: C. C. Young is a multi-service retirement community dedicated to the elderly, their families and the community, providing programs and facilities in a continuum of care extending from home and community-based services to residential and full-time nursing care.Residential Living: At C. C. Young our residents shape their own future in residential living. They continue to discover, grow and be creative in C. C. Young's vision. Our services give residents the privacy and freedom they desire while allowing residents to enjoy their independence without the responsibility of maintaining a house. All resdidential living areas offer additional venues where residents dine and gather for social opportunities.Assisted Living: At C. C. Young Assisted Living we provide residents with a full range of services that allow autonomy, privacy and a true sense of value. We target activities of daily living such as medication management, meals and bathing assistance so an individual in assisted living can maintain an independent lifestyle. Our assisted living program is assisted living that promotes our philosophy of love, freedom, security, and self-growth. Residents are encouraged to participate in an enjoyable community lifestyle while feeling secure in the knowledge that C. C. Young's 24-hour staff is there to provide compassionate support and personal care when needed.Skilled Nursing: Our Health Services provide a constellation of service that values the aged and offers opportunities for individuals 55 years of age and better. The continuum of services includes Medicare Certified skilled rehabilitation, licensed nursing care and nursing level dementia care.Hospice: At C. C. Young, all phases of life are significantly important. End of life is an opportunity for terminally ill persons and their families to celebrate the relationships and experiences they have had during their life, as well as the coming to terms with life in general. Seasons Hospice works with the individual to help ensure each person is able to enjoy this time of development. Through our qualified and supportive hospice staff we provide comfort, including pain management, clergy support if desired, and nursing care. Keeping the individual comfortable and free of pain enables each individual to find acceptance and fulfillment in this final stage of life.Center for Wellness and Renewal: At C. C. Young rehabilitation has taken a big step forward. A new state of the art outpatient rehabilitation gym was opened in late 2009 and covers more than 2500 square feet in the Lawther Point East building. The new gym is available to our skilled nursing residents receiving care on our medicare certified unit, and to all residents and the surrounding community through our outpatient rehab.Volunteers: We have bountiful volunteer opportunities for people with a giving spirit. We welcome church, youth and school groups, as well as community volunteer organizations-or simply individuals who believe as we do: that seniors should be valued all through life. Volunteers discover wonderful volunteer opportunities here. At C. C. young's three campus beauty shops, it is volunteers who style hair and provide manicures. Volunteers help out at church services, holiday festivities, ice cream socials and birthday parties. C. C. Young also has an ongoing need for hospice companions. Volunteers work on campus beautification projects and use their clerical skills for the greater good of our community. Volunteers teach arts and crafts class, play the piano, lead book discussions, or use other talents to bring living to a fine art for our residents.The Point, Center for Arts and Education: The Point, Center for Arts and Education, is unlike anything else in our region. The Point is not only a free-standing building which opened in 2007, but a true center which fulfills C. C. Young's goal of a seamless society of all ages. We are dedicated to exploration of new ideas, learning, creativity, and caring. The Point is truly centered around body, mind and spirit for those 55 and better. The Point is open from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. for all C. C. Young residents and the general public.Pastoral Care: Pastoral Care at C. C. Young strengthens the connection of residents with their local churches, develops a wide range of spiritual programming on the C. C. Young campus, and provides consistent, personal pastoral care to our residents.Collaborators: Our Mission is to work with others to transform our complementary service responses to the aged. Through collaboration we will intensify and broaden our programs and services so that each individual may flourish in body, mind and spirit. C. C. Young has invaluable collaborative support from so many which is realized every day on campus. Our collaborative relationships have been designed to help both parties achieve their mutual and respective goals and purposes. In 2010 we worked with over 40 collaborative partners.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: CC YOUNG MEMORIAL HOME'S INTENDED USE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS TO SUPPORT BENEVOLENT CARE.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: C.C. Young Group adopted the income tax standard for uncertain tax positions. This standard clarifies the accounting for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in an organization's financial statements in accordance with the income tax standard. This standard prescribes recognition and measurement of tax positions taken or expected to be taken on a tax return that are not certain to be realized.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1: TARRANT COUNTY CULTURAL EDUCATION FACILITIES FINANCE CORPORATION

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: TO FUND DEBT SERVICE AND FUND ISSUANCE COSTS OF PRIOR SERIES BONDS.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1: TARRANT COUNTY CULTURAL EDUCATION FACILITIES FINANCE CORPORATION

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: TO FINANCE THE COSTS RELATED TO NEW CONSTRUCTION.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CENTER FOR WELLNESS AND RENEWAL WAS OPENED PROVIDING REHABILITATION SERVICES AND THERAPY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CC YOUNG MEMORIAL HOME'S FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND MANAGEMENT BEFORE IT IS FILED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CC YOUNG MEMORIAL HOME REGULARLY AND CONSISTENTLY MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY THROUGH ANNUAL DISCLOSURE DOCUMENTATION. CC YOUNG MEMORIAL HOME'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS AND APPROVES ALL RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CC YOUNG MEMORIAL HOME'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE COMPENSATION OF TOP MANAGEMENT AND KEY EMPLOYEES. A MARKET COMPENSATION STUDY REVIEWED BY EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE DETERMINES THE COMPENSATION OF THE OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALTHOUGH NOT REQUIRED, CC YOUNG MEMORIAL HOME MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE MSRB FILINGS AND UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Schedule G, Part I, Line 2b, Column (v)
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: C.C. YOUNG CONTRACTED WITH THIS INDIVIDUAL TO ASSIST IN THE WRITING OF VARIOUS GRANTS. C.C. YOUNG DOES THE ACTUAL SOLICITING AND FUNDRAISING ACTIVITIES.
SCH K, PART I, LINE B, COLUMN C: CUSIP NUMBERS RELATED TO THIS BOND ARE 87638RDH7, 87638RDJ3, 87638RDG9, 87638RDF1.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: TO PROVIDE AFFORDABLE HOUSING TO SENIORS
